total_subquestions_ys: Q1: Identify the cells that are surrounded by 3s in the input grid.
Q2: Identify the cells that are not surrounded by 3s but contain a number other than 0.
Q3: Create a new grid with the same dimensions as the input grid.
Q4: Fill in the new grid with the numbers from the cells identified in Q2.
Q5: For the cells identified in Q1, calculate the average of the numbers in the surrounding cells in the input grid.
Q6: Round the averages calculated in Q5 to the nearest whole number and fill in the corresponding cells in the new grid.
Q7: For the cells in the new grid that were not filled in Q4 or Q6, fill them with 0.
Q1: Identify the cells that are surrounded by 3s in the input grid.
Q2: Identify the cells that are not surrounded by 3s but contain a number other than 0.
Q3: Create a new grid that only includes the cells identified in Q1 and Q2.
Q4: For the cells identified in Q2, replace the number with the number of 3s surrounding it in the original grid.
Q5: For the cells identified in Q1, replace the number with the number of non-3s surrounding it in the original grid.
Q6: Combine the cells from Q4 and Q5 to form the final output grid.
Q1: Identify the cells that are surrounded by 3s in the input grid.
Q2: Identify the cells that are not surrounded by 3s but have a value greater than 0.
Q3: Create a new grid with the same dimensions as the input grid.
Q4: Fill in the new grid with the values from the cells identified in Q1 and Q2.
Q5: For the cells filled from Q1, replace the value with the maximum value of the neighboring cells in the input grid.
Q6: For the cells filled from Q2, replace the value with the minimum value of the neighboring cells in the input grid.
Q7: Identify the cells in the new grid that have a value of 0 and are surrounded by cells with a value greater than 0.
Q8: Replace the value of the cells identified in Q7 with the average value of the neighboring cells.
Q9: Identify the cells in the new grid that have a value of 0 and are not surrounded by cells with a value greater than 0.
Q10: Replace the value of the cells identified in Q9 with the maximum value of the neighboring cells in the input grid.
Q11: Return the new grid as the output grid.
